result.execSummary:
The defendant Tou Yia Yang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tou Yia Yang

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Tou Yia Yang
Current: 317 Verrill Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 08-21-2017)
Prior: 608 Johns Dr D, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Tou Yia Yang in court with attorney Peter Christopher Lloyd. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:37 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.

Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Count 2 is being dismissed and read in. State recommends $250 fine plus costs.

Atty Lloyd concurs.
Defendant concurs.  

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Lloyd for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Found Guilty Disorderly Conduct, Domestic
Count 2: Dismissed and Read in

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, Defendant is currently on probation in Minnesota until April of 2018, and his probation will be adjusted for his needs from this case.
Atty Lloyd makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.

Court finds plea agreement fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Pay a fine of $250 plus costs
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge of $100
Submit to DNA Sample
Plea hearing on April 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
